channel.title: Home on Portfolio - Preston Locke
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Portfolio - Preston Locke

item.title: Password Manager
item.description: A partner and I created this application for our Computer Security and Privacy course as our final project. The goal was to implement a basic password manager that could properly encrypt/decrypt information, as well as provide feedback to the user about the strength of each password. I implemented most of the functionality, including data storage and encryption, as well as the optimized algorithm for checking passwords against pre-existing dictionaries of insecure passwords.

item.title: QNotPad
item.description: Using the Qt framework, I wrote a simple GUI text editor in C++, modeled after Notepad on Windows.

item.title: CPUID
item.description: Using C++ code that interfaces with hand-written Assembly, I wrote a terminal application that reads the info about your CPU using the CPUID Assembly instruction.

item.title: A* Algorithm Visualization
item.description: This project used the PyGame library for Python. Myself and two other classmates collaborated over the last month of our Algorithms course to create this visualization as our final project. I mainly worked on the user interface because I was able to quickly learn how to use PyGame to create the cells and the UI control elements, as well as the main event loop for the program.

item.title: PotLuck
item.description: PotLuck is a cross-platform mobile application that helps people find recipes based on the ingredients they already have. You can cook alone or with friends, and the app allows you to pool together your group’s available ingredients. By removing the guesswork out of knowing what what’s needed vs what you already have, PotLuck makes it easy to decide what to cook. The app was implemented using Flutter for the UI and Firebase for the user authentication, data storage (Cloud Firestore), and recipe search backend (Cloud Functions/Node.
